doc:
Lynn Dalby https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lynn_Dalby 0 Lynn Dalby (born 17 February 1947) is an English actress. Dalby was born in Harrogate. She is most notable for her role as Ruth Merrick Sugden in the soap opera Emmerdale Farm in 1972. Dalby starred as Hazel in the 1970s series Budgie, which also starred Adam Faith, of which 26 episodes were made in 1970 and 1971. She trained at the Corona Theatre School with future Emmerdale co-star Frazer Hines. She appeared in Crossroads as a secretary called Rita Hughes, and acted in the 1975 horror film Legend of the Werewolf, before starring in the crime drama Breakaway (1980). After the end of her six-year marriage to the actor Ray Lonnen, Dalby emigrated to Australia. Lynn_Dalby ( born 17_February_1947 ) is an_English_actress . Dalby was_born in Harrogate . She is most_notable for her_role as Ruth_Merrick_Sugden in the_soap_opera_Emmerdale_Farm in 1972 . Dalby starred as Hazel in the_1970s_series_Budgie , which also starred Adam_Faith , of which 26_episodes were_made in 1970_and_1971 . She trained at the_Corona_Theatre_School with future_Emmerdale_co-star_Frazer_Hines . She appeared in Crossroads as a_secretary called Rita_Hughes , and acted in the_1975_horror_film_Legend of the_Werewolf , before starring in the_crime_drama_Breakaway_(_1980_) . After the_end of her_six-year_marriage to the_actor_Ray_Lonnen , Dalby emigrated to Australia .
